intro: Bauhinia macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered bauhinia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a velvety texture. Bauhinia macrantha is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. It also has the ability to fix nitrogen through its root nodules, contributing to soil fertility.
